                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>

                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"
                                        codeListValue="author">author

                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                    
                    <gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                        <gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                            <gmd:organisationName>
                                <gco:CharacterString>Oathill Lake Conservation Society</gco:CharacterString>
                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>
                                <gmd:CI_RoleCode
                                        codeList="https://schemas.isotc211.org/19115/-3/cit/1.0/codelists.xml#CI_RoleCode"
                                        codeListValue="contributor">contributor

                            </gmd:role>
                        </gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty>
                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Oathill Lake Conservation Society is a group of concerned neighbours of Oathill Lake, a small urban lake in Dartmouth Nova Scotia.  It started when changes were noticed in the lake ecosystems, including increased fish stocking and fishing activities, loss of amphibian populations, and erosion of the lake shore.  A measurement program was started to provide baseline depth profiles of oxygen, temperature, salinity/conductivity and pH, and was followed by by-weekly (during open water periods) sampling to track the effects of a number of changes in the lake environment intended to correct the problems noted, as well as the impacts of natural and other man-made events and activities on the lake habitat.  Depth profiles are collected at 3 fixed locations in the lake, and, on a less-regular basis, at four of the more significant storm sewer drains into the lake.  Other data are collected from long-duration data loggers (e.g., temperature-depth profiles at the deepest part of the lake, and winter temperature and conductivity in the main in-flow channel) and physical samples collected for laboratory analysis of nutrients and minerals.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>
            <gmd:credit gco:nilReason="missing"/>

            </gmd:resourceConstraints>

            </gmd:language>

            </gmd:topicCategory>

                            </gmd:eastBoundLongitude>
                            <gmd:southBoundLatitude>

                            </gmd:southBoundLatitude>
                            <gmd:northBoundLatitude>

                            </gmd:northBoundLatitude>
                        </gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox>
                    </gmd:geographicElement>
                    <gmd:temporalElement>
                        <gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>
                            <gmd:extent>
                                <gml:TimePeriod gml:id="TimePeriod">
                                    <gml:description>seconds</gml:description>
                                    <gml:beginPosition>2013-08-06T17:42:00+00:00</gml:beginPosition>
                                    <gml:endPosition>2023-12-02T10:34:00+00:00</gml:endPosition>

                    </gmd:temporalElement>

                        <gmd:maximumValue>

    </gmd:identificationInfo>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-wtt6-6k82
notes: The Oathill Lake Conservation Society is a group of concerned neighbours of Oathill Lake, a small urban lake in Dartmouth Nova Scotia.  It started when changes were noticed in the lake ecosystems, including increased fish stocking and fishing activities, loss of amphibian populations, and erosion of the lake shore.  A measurement program was started to provide baseline depth profiles of oxygen, temperature, salinity/conductivity and pH, and was followed by by-weekly (during open water periods) sampling to track the effects of a number of changes in the lake environment intended to correct the problems noted, as well as the impacts of natural and other man-made events and activities on the lake habitat.  Depth profiles are collected at 3 fixed locations in the lake, and, on a less-regular basis, at four of the more significant storm sewer drains into the lake.  Other data are collected from long-duration data loggers (e.g., temperature-depth profiles at the deepest part of the lake, and winter temperature and conductivity in the main in-flow channel) and physical samples collected for laboratory analysis of nutrients and minerals.

notes_translated.en: The Oathill Lake Conservation Society is a group of concerned neighbours of Oathill Lake, a small urban lake in Dartmouth Nova Scotia.  It started when changes were noticed in the lake ecosystems, including increased fish stocking and fishing activities, loss of amphibian populations, and erosion of the lake shore.  A measurement program was started to provide baseline depth profiles of oxygen, temperature, salinity/conductivity and pH, and was followed by by-weekly (during open water periods) sampling to track the effects of a number of changes in the lake environment intended to correct the problems noted, as well as the impacts of natural and other man-made events and activities on the lake habitat.  Depth profiles are collected at 3 fixed locations in the lake, and, on a less-regular basis, at four of the more significant storm sewer drains into the lake.  Other data are collected from long-duration data loggers (e.g., temperature-depth profiles at the deepest part of the lake, and winter temperature and conductivity in the main in-flow channel) and physical samples collected for laboratory analysis of nutrients and minerals.
notes_translated.fr: La Oathill Lake Conservation Society est un groupe de voisins inquiets du lac Oathill, un petit lac urbain de Dartmouth, en Nouvelle-Écosse. Tout a commencé lorsque des changements ont été constatés dans les écosystèmes lacustres, notamment l'augmentation des stocks de poissons et des activités de pêche, la perte de populations d'amphibiens et l'érosion des rives du lac. Un programme de mesures a été lancé pour fournir des profils de profondeur de référence de l'oxygène, de la température, de la salinité/conductivité et du pH, et a été suivi d'un échantillonnage toutes les deux semaines (pendant les périodes d'eau libre) pour suivre les effets d'un certain nombre de changements dans l'environnement du lac destinés à corriger les problèmes constatés, ainsi que les impacts des événements et activités naturels et autres événements et activités anthropiques sur l'habitat du lac. Les profils de profondeur sont recueillis à trois endroits fixes du lac et, de façon moins régulière, à quatre des collecteurs d'égouts pluviaux les plus importants du lac. D'autres données sont recueillies à partir d'enregistreurs de données de longue durée (par exemple, les profils de température et de profondeur dans la partie la plus profonde du lac, et la température et la conductivité hivernales dans le canal d'alimentation principal) et des échantillons physiques prélevés pour l'analyse en laboratoire des nutriments et des minéraux.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Oathill Lake Conservation Society Water Monitoring

title_translated.en: Oathill Lake Conservation Society Water Monitoring
title_translated.fr: Surveillance de l'eau par la Société de conservation du lac Oathill
